definition: old-style wooden folding armchair, typically featuring a footrest/(fig.) position in a hierarchy
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

sentences.english: Michael Jordan used to reign as the number one basketball player in NBA.
sentences.chinese: 邁克爾喬丹曾是稱霸籃壇第一把交椅的球員。

sentences.english: But Europe could soon take the top spot on the space junk tally.
sentences.chinese: 不過歐洲在太空垃圾排行榜上即將“執頭把交椅”。

sentences.english: In Iceland, Sigurdardottir now sits at thehead of that table.
sentences.chinese: 在冰島，塞格達杜迪如今坐上了頭把交椅。

sentences.english: His name is Todd, my lord, and he is the very last word in barbering.
sentences.chinese: 他的名字叫陶德，大人，理髮界的第一把交椅。

sentences.english: Those factors have helped the BlackBerry hold its position at the top of the enterprise food chain.
sentences.chinese: 這些因素幫助黑莓穩坐“商業手機鏈”的頭把交椅。

sentences.english: Technology is big, with the top spot held by a tech giant.
sentences.chinese: 科技是老大，一家科技巨頭公司坐了頭把交椅。

sentences.english: Only after twenty years' jockeying for power did he attain this position of great influence.
sentences.chinese: 勾心鬥角二十年，他才爬上了這把極有權勢的金交椅。

definition: to be on an equal footing
old-fashioned square table to seat eight people
to be unwilling to pass on one's responsibilities to others
Liu Bei's five great generals in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, namely: Guan Yu 關羽|关羽, Zhang Fei 張飛|张飞, Zhao Yun 趙雲|赵云, Ma Chao 馬超|马超, Huang Zhong 黃忠|黄忠
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
steady as Mt Tai/as safe as houses
to be perched high/to be located prominently/to be preeminent
